result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan A Aleman Jr

defendant.name: Aleman, Juan A, Jr
defendant.address: 2401 W. Maple Street- REAR, Milwaukee, WI 53204

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Klein requesting to adjourn the 10/27/22 hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/27/22 - Approved.**
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

COURT ORDERS A CASH BOND IN PLACE OF THE SIGNATURE BOND.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

10:45 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.   Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter was set to address WCS non-compliance and reviews the report on the record.  Atty. Klein presents statements with respect to the WCS non-compliance; she is asking the court to just admonish the defendant and not take any action with respect to bail.  State presents statements; they are asking the court modify bail to cash.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will order bail be modified to $500.00 Cash in place of the signature bond; conditions to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled Hearing on 10/27/2022 at 3:00 p.m.
Bail/bond hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/10/2022 received and filed.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 10/12/22 - court to get in sooner to address the non-compliance.**
Hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:45 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.  Court notes a preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver has been filed.  Atty. Klein confirms her client is prepared to waive his preliminary hearing today.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waiving his right to preliminary hearing.  State has filed the Information.  Atty. Klein acknowledges receipt and waives reading. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Klein provides an update; she is requesting a further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

addressed to: Juan Aleman Jr
No longer in custody
Hearing on September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Juan A Aleman Jr
Current: 2401 W. Maple Street- REAR, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

8:16 AM Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court.  Attorney Mark Powers for attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.  Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Powers states Attorney Klein is currently in another county this morning and requests the Court adjourn this for an anticipated waiver of preliminary hearing.  The Court notes the defendant has a date on 22CM34 set for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am and will tag this matter along for an anticipated waiver of preliminary hearing.  If defendant does not waive, the preliminary hearing to be set back before Commissioner Court.  Preliminary time limits waived.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

9:07 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr.   Court notes the matter is before the Court on Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Klein presents arguments; she is asking bail be lowered or modified to a signature bond.  State objects and presents arguments.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Court will order bond modified to a $2000.00 signature bond and all conditions to remain as previously set.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled preliminary hearing set for 09/19/2022 at 8:15 AM.
Bail/bond hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty Klein

8:19 AM Defendant Juan A Aleman Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin G Griffis for Attorney Klein in court for Juan A Aleman Jr. Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court notes that it called the SPD, who states that attorney Klein will be appointed, but had a prior engagement and could not make it to today's hearing.
The Court finds good cause to toll the time limits. 
The Court will set the matter for prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
